[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/sim.rs] [Function: Fund::execute()] [Audit Trail] Are funding operations logged with sufficient detail (who, when, how much) to detect suspicious patterns or simulate real-world attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/sim.rs] [Function: ViewResource::execute()] [StructTag Injection] Does the resource parameter properly validate StructTag format, or can malformed tags cause parsing errors that leak information through error messages? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/sim.rs] [Function: ViewResource::execute()] [Account Enumeration] Can an attacker enumerate all accounts in a session by iterating through addresses and viewing their resources, potentially mapping the entire state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/sim.rs] [Function: ViewResource::execute()] [Type Confusion] Can an attacker specify a StructTag that doesn't match the actual resource type at that address, causing type confusion bugs or crashes in view_resource()? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/sim.rs] [Function: ViewResource::execute()] [JSON Serialization] Does view_resource() properly sanitize resource data before JSON serialization, or can malicious resource content cause injection attacks or break JSON parsing? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/sim.rs] [Function: ViewResource::execute()] [Error Information Leak] Do error messages from view_resource() expose sensitive information about session structure, file paths, or internal state details? (Low)
